TopicTitle: The COMPLETE KSP Blender Tutorial! [Video Back!]

Articles.Content:
Thanks for the reply, I\'ll look into it after work today

[edit]Thanks for that, it has been extremely useful

While this video tutorial may or may not have useful information, I find the auto-pausing thing infuriating, to the point where the tutorial is utterly useless for me. Seriously, there are no words to express my rage right now. The video doesn\'t pause itself long enough for me to even read the information, let alone perform the actions in Blender, and when I try to pause it manually the damn speech bubble goes away! And when I try to jump to an earlier point to have the information repeated, the speech bubble doesn\'t appear at all. This is ridiculous. Get rid of that nonsense, please. Just let me pause the damn thing myself when I want to.

Ok, note taken. It might be a rainy week this week. So might get a chance to redo it all.

Oh, I\'ll have to brush up on all the recent changes.

Yeah... sorry about the tone of that. Like I said, I was incredibly angry when I wrote that. Not so much at you but rather at youtube itself for this half-baked \'feature\'. The best thing in the world would be to have the tutorial narrated with your actual voice. It does seem like it contains information very useful for Blender-noobs like myself.
I got a mic but it crackles like a WOW player eating cheetos... (Is that too low?)

I got tired of manually editing dae files for import to Blender, so I wrote a little Python script that should take care of most dae file problems.

Written and tested with Python 2.6.6, some knowledge of using python scripts would be helpful to the user

That sounds handy... Where can we find this script?

What I\'m *really* looking for is a nice simple tool or technique for importing an existing (e.g. stock) part, tweaking it\'s dimensions, (e.g. doubling or tripling the length of a fuel tank), and saving it back with minimum fuss. I can then tweak the CFG file to match. The goal is to reduce component count in my ships without deviating too far from the visual style and other characteristics of the stock parts. (I.e. the same ship *could* be built with stock parts and behave the same, but using one remodelled part to replace three stock ones improves the performance of the physics engine.)

Any suggestions? Is this a useful use-case for a demo video?
Its weird. I follow the tutorial to the ltetter with a simple model, and bam it works. Use the model I want to and loading forever. Is 6mb too big?

6mb is too large for a simple model by several magnitudes. My largest .dae is 899KB and that\'s 4.8k polys. Remember that all you need from blender is a part mesh with UV map and a simple node_collider, there is no need for animations,textures, shaders or anything else.

Hitting alt-F2 brings up the KSP console which allows you to see the error KSP gives you on load.

Does it finish loading (loading for along time) or never finish loading (stuck loading forever)? If it never finishes, you could post it here... but there is a 5mb limit.

My shuttle engine I\'m working on is 10k polys I think. It takes an ages to pass the first time, because the game checks it and loads it into the games files. But after that the game loads quick and smoothly. Anything over 3mb (about 20-30k polys?) is probably pushing a little too far right now.

If you can post the error or part we could help solve the problem.

i would need some help with my current 'SF-IPS project', this current model not only has no proper texture, but no collision mesh!

expect more problems while i continue with this project

Not sure what you have done there, but your file has no faces!

But no worries... Super Ben is here.

Now you can texture it. A simple cube could work for a node_collider. Perhaps with the top extended and shrunk down to give it a taper.

Not sure what you have done there, but your file has no faces!

But no worries... Super Ben is here.

Now you can texture it. A simple cube could work for a node_collider. Perhaps with the top extended and shrunk down to give it a taper.

i think it was that the face edit mode was off
Nope. That should not remove the faces. I guess 'delete' must have been pressed at some point.

the problem is that it is just 2 faces, how do i make it a complete model?

(this is supposed to be a rcs tank btw)

I am not sure what you did there. Try the download from my post again. It has the full model.

To make a node collider, just use a cube for now. Resize it in edit mode to fit the size of the tank.

I am not sure what you did there. Try the download from my post again. It has the full model.

To make a node collider, just use a cube for now. Resize it in edit mode to fit the size of the tank.

it\'s an rcs tank, not a fuel tank, btw i took the faces from the cargobay and the cockpit because it functions like an adapter
nevermind...just fixed the problem myself by selecting vertices and pressing f
In .15 you can make the collider mesh in Unity.

ok, i have various problems with my project now regarding colliders and invisible parts, i also don\'t know how i could texture it and i qould like to ask if someone else could texture it for me

the problem and the part downloads are in the main project page

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=12019.0
Thanks for the tutorial, really helped me. But I have one question. Why did you apply quads to tris in the end?
I have difficulties doing it. As a matter of fact, the youtube video is to quick !

I have difficulties doing it. As a matter of fact, the youtube video is to quick !

That\'s why they invented the pause button! And to further that, the re-wind button!

No need for sarcasm, but i cannot pause quickly enough for some sentences. As you can see on the top left corner in the video, is a loading sign, wich doesen\'t help very much on using pause, actually is disrupting it !

I have to agree with Vlad. The video is so cramped with information, it is hard to grasp. The pause button doesn\'t provide much help with that. The video seems more like a reminder of all the functions to those who already know blender than help a complete novice learn some tricks of the trade. It happens often that i have to replay the video several times just to find where a particular button is located (and then i still have to find out which option of a following menu i have to choose).

The video is good, no doubt about it, but the pace is much to fast for a n00b.

But on the positive side: This evening i finally have learned something about Blender from this tutorial and several others (YAAY!).

One question though. Can you use a duplicate of the shape you\'ve made for the collision thingy?

I have to agree with Vlad. The video is so cramped with information, it is hard to grasp. The pause button doesn\'t provide much help with that. The video seems more like a reminder of all the functions to those who already know blender than help a complete novice learn some tricks of the trade. It happens often that i have to replay the video several times just to find where a particular button is located (and then i still have to find out which option of a following menu i have to choose).

The video is good, no doubt about it, but the pace is much to fast for a n00b.

But on the positive side: This evening i finally have learned something about Blender from this tutorial and several others (YAAY!).

One question though. Can you use a duplicate of the shape you\'ve made for the collision thingy?

I have, seems to work as normal.
Thank you. That will make building a part a lot easier (for me, at least).
